void cbOS_init ( void   )

void* cbOS_receive ( cbOS_MsgId  msgId[],
cb_int32  nMsg 
)

Receive a message.

Parameters:
msgId Specifies what kind of messages to receive.
nMsg specifies how many identifiers the msgId vector contains. If all messages are to be received, the msgId parameter is set to NULL and the nMsg parameter is set to 0.
Returns:
NULL if no message is available, otherwise a pointer to a message.
See also:
cbOS_send

void cbOS_send ( cbOS_ProcessId  processId,
void *  pMsg 
)

Send a message to a specified process.

Parameters:
processId Identifier of receiving process. Use cbOS_PROCESS_ID macro. E.g. cbOS_PROCESS_ID(SAMPLE_process)
pMsg Pointer to message allocated by the cbOS_allocMessage function.
